general.title: Ice Core Contributions To Global Change Research: Past Successes and Future Directions
general.description: The U.S. ice coring community has, in concert with its international partners, made remarkable strides to advance in the understanding of global change. This document was assembled by the Ice Core Working Group (ICWG), and provides a synthesis of the global change lessons learned thus far, and the requirements and plans for solving new global change questions utilizing future ice coring activities. Sections on lessons learned include: the greenhouse/gas relationship, rapid climate change events, natural climate variability during the Holocene, extreme events (volcanoes and biomass burning), recent climate change as a precursor to modern climate, hindcasting instruments, anthropogenic impact on atmospheric chemistry, and human response to climate change as deduced from the paleorecord.
